snippet: Students are bombarding their dream schools with baked goods, craft projects and dossiers of testimonials in an effort to get an edge — and get off the waiting list.
abstract: Admissions officers at colleges say that students who have been waitlisted will often go too far in attempting to convince officials that they belong at the institution of their choice; officials caution that there is no way to predict how many seats will become available in their fall semesters, and that best way for students to communicate with colleges is in informed and mature manner.
lead_paragraph: Students are bombarding their dream schools with baked goods, craft projects and dossiers of testimonials in an effort to get an edge — and get off the waiting list.

headline.seo: On the Waiting List, Some College Applicants Try a Little Dazzle
headline.main: On a College Waiting List? Sending Cookies Isn’t Going to Help
headline.print_headline: On a College Waiting List? Sending Cookies Isn’t Going to Help
